Action: Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/applications
Expected Test Results: * At the top, the "Bulk Edit Records" box is visible, and "Submit" is disabled

Action: From the "Select action" pull-down, choose "Change Status"
Expected Test Results:
* A new pull-down appears beneath the first, containing all the application statuses
* "Submit" remains disabled

Action: Open the "Application Status" facet on the left, and select a filter which has a small number of results (such as "Ready" or "Revisions Required")
Select a new status from the "Bulk Edit Records" section
Expected Test Results: * "Submit" becomes active

Action: Select the blank status value from the "Bulk Edit Records" section
Expected Test Results: * "Submit" deactivates

Action: Select a new status from the "Bulk Edit Records" section

Expected Test Results:
* An alert pops up asking you to confirm the action
* The alert identifies a number of affected records which is the same as the number of search results
* The operation is aborted

* A message banner appears which tells you your request has be queued
* The message banner identifies a number of affected records which is the same as the number of search results
* The "Bulk Edit Records" box has reset to its default state, with "Submit" disabled

Action: Click the link in the banner text 'You can see your request here in the background jobs interface (opens new tab).'
Expected Test Results:
* A new tab opens and shows just your background job with appropriate 'job created' and 'job last updated' dates.
* The status of the job is "queued"
* The created date and last updated date are appropriate

* Detailed information about the job appears
* The parameters suggestion_bulk_edit__editor_group and suggestion_bulk_edit__note are empty
* The field suggestion_bulk_edit__ids contains the same number of ids as were in your search results
* The field suggestion_bulk_edit_application_status shows the application status you selected

* The message banner disappears
* The Submit button is inactive again

Action: Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/applications
Select "Assign to editor group" from the "Bulk Edit Records" box
Expected Test Results: * A new pull-down box appears that says 'Start typing'

Action: Type the first few letters of an editor group
Expected Test Results: * The pull-down suggests possible values for you to enter

Action: Click on the small "x" in the pull-down box
Expected Test Results: * The value is cleared

Action: Enter another value in the pull-down box

Expected Test Results: * A message banner appears which tells you your request has be queued

Action: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created
Expected Test Results: * The background job opens in a new tab and only one task is shown.

* The field suggestion_bulk_edit__editor_group contains the editor group you selected
* The fields suggestion_bulk_edit__note and suggestion_bulk_edit__application_status are empty

* The message banner disappears
* The Submit button is inactive again
